alert.note: Alert for Lee; Phillips (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 09 at 12:59PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTH CENTRAL LEE AND NORTHERN PHILLIPS COUNTIES THROUGH 130 PM CST... At 1259 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Marvell, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Marianna, Marvell, St Francis National Park, Helena-West Helena, Lexa, Rondo, Watkins Corner, Lagrange, Jeffersonville, Haleside, Quarles, Wycamp, Latour, Turkey Scratch, Vineyard, Cypress Corner, Poplar Grove, Big Creek Corner, Barton, and Kindall. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CST for eastern Arkansas...and northwestern Mississippi.
